main event: On 12 Apr 1958, north of Selfridge Air Force Base in Michigan, there were observations of two large and six small orange objects, with the six small objects coming out of the two large ones. They were seen traveling in pairs, emitting vapor trails, and moving from east to west. The duration of the sighting was approximately 2 minutes, but no photographs were taken. The observer was a civilian, and the case was considered an unreliable report due to insufficient data for evaluation.
interesting points: Eight objects were observed, with the six small objects emerging from the two large ones.
The objects emitted orange color and were surrounded by vapor trails.
The objects traveled in pairs, moving from east to west.
The sighting lasted for around 2 minutes but no photographs were taken.
The report was considered unreliable due to insufficient data for evaluation.
sighted object: Two large and six small orange objects
location: north of Selfridge Air Force Base, Michigan
